column4: I have a network problem... I have this: http://pastebin.com/m60a316d4 and everytime I reboot I have to manually setup the default gateway... why?
can you pastebin the output of sudo route -n before you have to add the route?
restarting system...
ok
http://pastebin.com/m5786db4e
what is the peth0 interface?
that's Xen's interface...
how can you have the same ip on both interfaces? you need to relook at the config.
forget about peth0 if you don't know about xen...
forget about getting your packets to go out of eth0 with that configuration
also pastebin route -n after that route addition, you will see the difference
the best way is to bridge the interfaces if you want to do that
when I try to add now, I get: SIOCADDRT: File exists
sorry i cant help you, i dont know anything about xen; please try the xen channel (if there is one)
##xen
have been there already... but it is problem that occurred today, and Xen was installed on the system for months
does it work if you do a sudo ifconfig peth0 down ?
nope...
whats your route -n after you bring that iface down?
seems same
are you sure? sudo ifconfig should not show an ip address on peth0 (which would indicate that it is down), also ifdown peth0 should do the same
sudo ifconfig doesn't even show peth0 :(
just delete the default route that points to peth0  (if that is not connected to the outside world)
